messages.title: Labour Smear Campaign
messages.content: A number of local residents have received letters or leaflets making personal attacks on local Lib Dem candidate Colin Eldridge.

messages.title: Alder Hey - The Hospital - The Facts
messages.content: Colin Eldridge chaired the campaign committee to save the Burns Unit. Last week, Labour's health minister admitted that Alder Hey's heart unit may be re-located to a centralised unit in Manchester. As a local MP, Colin Eldridge will fight to prevent this.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Healthcare - Saving the Alder Hey Burns Unit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Colin Eldridge led a community campaign to save the Burns Unit at Alder Hey and will continue to fight against its potential relocation.

mentions.candidate: Colin Eldridge is highlighted throughout the leaflet for his role in saving the Burns Unit at Alder Hey.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour's health minister and a Labour Councillor, Jo Anderson, are mentioned in relation to the smear campaign and the potential relocation of the heart unit.

issues.health: Colin Eldridge fought to save the Burns Unit at Alder Hey and objects to the potential relocation of the heart unit to Manchester.

images.caption: A photo of a leaflet addressing the Labour Smear Campaign against Lib Dem candidate Colin Eldridge and stating the facts about Alder Hey Hospital.
